channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: This week in science: elephant trunks, butterfly migration and a hot galaxy cluster
item.description: NPR's Short Wave talks about elephants' sniffing abilities, the remarkable migration of painted lady butterflies and a surprising discovery about the early universe.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Short Wave talks about elephants' sniffing abilities, the remarkable migration of painted lady butterflies and a surprising discovery about the early universe.
item.dc:creator: Berly McCoy

item.title: The 1970s hostage story of 'Dead Man's Wire' speaks across the decades
item.description: Gus Van Sant's police thriller Dead Man's Wire is a true-crime dramatization of a 1977 hostage incident in Indianapolis.
item.content:encoded: Gus Van Sant's police thriller Dead Man's Wire is a true-crime dramatization of a 1977 hostage incident in Indianapolis.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: Two parents reflect on giving back after Camp Mystic tragedy
item.description: After deadly floods hit Central Texas in July, families whose daughters died at a sleepaway camp are keeping their legacies alive. We speak to two parents who helped create the Heaven's 27 Foundation.
item.content:encoded: After deadly floods hit Central Texas in July, families whose daughters died at a sleepaway camp are keeping their legacies alive. We speak to two parents who helped create the Heaven's 27 Foundation.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: Nicolás Maduro will likely argue he's immune from U.S. prosecution
item.description: Former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro is expected to argue that his leadership role shields him from prosecution in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: Former Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro is expected to argue that his leadership role shields him from prosecution in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: What renewed ACA subsidies would mean for people facing more expensive health insurance
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Jamie Israel, a therapist and one of more than 20 million people seeing drastically increased health insurance costs after the non-renewal of federal ACA subsidies.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Jamie Israel, a therapist and one of more than 20 million people seeing drastically increased health insurance costs after the non-renewal of federal ACA subsidies.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: The NFL playoffs begin — with no heavyweight favorite expected to win
item.description: The NFL playoffs get underway this weekend. For the first time in a long time, there is no heavyweight favorite expected to win it all. The wide open field is sure to provide plenty of excitement.
item.content:encoded: The NFL playoffs get underway this weekend. For the first time in a long time, there is no heavyweight favorite expected to win it all. The wide open field is sure to provide plenty of excitement.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: NPR/Ipsos poll shows Americans doubt U.S. role as global moral leader
item.description: A new NPR/Ipsos poll released Friday finds Americans still want the U.S. to be a moral leader in the world — but far fewer think it actually is.
item.content:encoded: A new NPR/Ipsos poll released Friday finds Americans still want the U.S. to be a moral leader in the world — but far fewer think it actually is.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Hunger in the U.S.: The invisible and lasting scars
item.description: Hunger in the U.S. doesn't look like third-world famine. But the physical impacts on health -- and the psychological scars -- can last a lifetime.
item.content:encoded: Hunger in the U.S. doesn't look like third-world famine. But the physical impacts on health -- and the psychological scars -- can last a lifetime.
item.dc:creator: Karen Brown

item.title: A reading list to better understand this moment in Venezuela
item.description: Venezuelan journalist and author Paula Ramon in Caracas offers a reading list for anyone wishing to gain a better understanding of Venezuela at this moment.
item.content:encoded: Venezuelan journalist and author Paula Ramon in Caracas offers a reading list for anyone wishing to gain a better understanding of Venezuela at this moment.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse

item.title: State officials say they'll do their own probes of shootings by federal officers
item.description: We get an overview of the two newsworthy shootings that happened involving an ICE agent in Minneapolis and a border patrol officer Portland this week.
item.content:encoded: We get an overview of the two newsworthy shootings that happened involving an ICE agent in Minneapolis and a border patrol officer Portland this week.
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste
